edu.jhu.cs.oose.fall2013.brickus.iface

Interface BrickusModel


  • public interface BrickusModel
    Classes implementing this interface declare that they are capable of serving as a standard Brickus model.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Adds a listener to this BrickusModel.

    • Method Detail

      • getWidth

        int getWidth()
        Establishes the width of the Brickus board.
        Returns:
        The width of the Brickus board.

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        Establishes the height of the Brickus board.
        Returns:
        The height of the Brickus board.

      • getContents

        Player getContents(int x,
                 int y)
                   throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Determines the contents of the cell with the given location.
        Parameters:
        x - The X coordinate of the location.
        y - The Y coordinate of the location.
        Returns:
        The contents of that cell in terms of the player who owns a brick there. If no brick is at that location, null is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If the provided X or Y coordinate is out of range.

      • getPieces

        java.util.List<BrickusPiece> getPieces(Player player)
        Determines which pieces the specified player has remaining. The list returned by this method should not be modified by the caller. An implementation of this method may take steps to enforce this behavior (such as by using Collections.unmodifiableList(List)).
        Parameters:
        player - An object identifying the player in question.
        Returns:
        The pieces the player has yet to place.

      • placePiece

        void placePiece(Player player,
              int x,
              int y,
              BrickusPiece piece)
        Indicates that the active player is attempting to place the provided piece. The piece's grid's upper-left corner should be positioned at the specified location. This method in particular is obligated to report an appropriate event to all listeners of the model; it must either report a movement (when the move is legal) or an illegal move (when it is not).
        Parameters:
        player - The player for whom the piece is to be placed.
        x - The X coordinate of the piece's grid on the Brickus board.
        y - The Y coordinate of the piece's grid on the Brickus board.
        piece - The piece which is being placed. This method must not be called after the game has ended (that is, after a BrickusEvent has been issued declaring the game to be over).
        Throws:
        BrickusIllegalMoveEvent - If the specified placement is illegal. The caller should ensure that the user receives the message on this exception.

      • pass

        void pass(Player player)
        Indicates that the player has chosen to pass. This method fires an event reflecting that the active player has changed, complete with game over flag if all players have passed. This method must not be called after the game has ended (that is, after a BrickusEvent has been issued declaring the game to be over).
        Parameters:
        player - The player who is passing.

      • getActivePlayer

        Player getActivePlayer()
        Indicate the player whose turn it is. If the game is over, this method returns null.
        Returns:
        The player who is currently moving.

      • addBrickusListener

        void addBrickusListener(BrickusListener listener)
        Adds a listener to this BrickusModel. The provided listener will be called whenever pertinent events are generated on this model.
        Parameters:
        listener - The BrickusListener to add to this BrickusModel.

      • removeBrickusListener

        void removeBrickusListener(BrickusListener listener)
        Removes a listener from this BrickusModel. The removed listener will no longer be called when events occur on this model.
        Parameters:
        listener - The BrickusListener to remove from this BrickusModel.

      • calculateScore

        int calculateScore(Player player)
        Calculates the score for the provided player. The player's score is equal to the number of squares he or she has placed on the board. Note that this should be the number of squares, not the number of pieces; that is, the plus-shaped piece would be worth five points.
        Parameters:
        player - The player for whom to calculate a score.
        Returns:
        The player's current score.
